keyword: how many calories in a slice of cheese
title: How Many Calories in a Slice of Cheese?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a slice of cheese, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and easy variations for different types.
h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Cheese?
assumptions: Standard cheddar cheese slice, ~28 g or 1 oz, processed or natural.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cheese type, brand, slice thickness, and processing; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of cheddar cheese contains about 113 kcal and 7 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use Swiss cheese instead of cheddar

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of cheddar cheese?
faqs.a: About 113 kcal for a standard 28 g slice.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in a slice of cheese?

faqs.a: Minimal, around 0.9 g carbs per slice, mostly from lactose.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a slice of cheese?
faqs.a: About 9.3 g total fat, with 5.9 g saturated.

faqs.q: Are there lower calorie cheese options?
faqs.a: Yes, low-fat varieties reduce calories to ~70-80 kcal per slice.
